actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Thursday, December 7, 2023,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, December 7, 2023, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

PN769:
        Jerry Edwards, Jr., of Louisiana, to be United States District Judge for the Western District of Louisiana

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN771:
        Brandon S. Long, of Louisiana, to be United States District Judge for the Eastern District of Louisiana

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.


 PN876:
        Harry Coker, Jr., of Kansas, to be National Cyber Director

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate 12/11/2023.


 PN904:
        Richard E.N. Federico, of Kansas, to be United States Circuit Judge for the Tenth Circuit

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 61 - 29. Record Vote Number: 336
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Durbin, at  7:00 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10:30 a.m. tomorrow.
